panelText.text: When it comes to gifts, remember:

• A gift is when one party provides a benefit to the other but does not share the benefit and there is no opportunity to discuss business.
  • Gifts should never be cash or cash equivalent (gift cards).
  • Gifts should never be exchanged when contracts are being renewed or being considered. Even if there is no intention of influencing the other person, someone looking on might interpret the exchange as a potential bribe.
  • Johnson Controls policies and reporting rules for gifts apply.
Some examples: a ticket given for an event or a voucher for a meal (without the giver being in attendance) or the giving of an item (traditional gift) during Christmas.
